text: Since 1949 (except 1990-1996), Slovakia has been divided into a number of kraje (singular kraj, usually translated as Regions, but mean rather county). Slovakia is currently divided into 8 regions. Each kraj is then divided into many okresy (singular okres, usually translated as districts). Slovakia currently has 79 districts. Each region is named after its capital. The following list shows: name of the region, its capital, number of districts, population (as of 2001) and area. # Bratislava Region, capital Bratislava - 8 districts, pop. 599,015, 2053km² # Trnava Region, capital Trnava - 7 districts, pop. 550,103, 4108km² # Trenčín Region, capital Trenčín - 9 districts, pop. 605,582, 4501km² # Nitra Region, capital Nitra - 7 districts, pop. 713,442, 6343km² # Žilina Region, capital Žilina - 11 districts, pop. 692,232, 6788km² # Banská Bystrica Region, capital Banská Bystrica - 13 districts, pop. 662,121, 9455km² # Prešov Region, capital Prešov - 13 districts, pop. 789,968, 8993km² # Košice Region, capital Košice - 11 districts, pop. 766,012, 6753km²
title: Regions of Slovakia
